title: Ted Cruz Loaned His Campaign $260,000. Supreme Court Weighs Whether He Can Get It All Back
sub_head: Justices question federal limits on Cruz campaign reimbursing candidate’s personal loan with postelection contributions
body:
WASHINGTON—The Supreme Court, weighing a legal battle involving Texas Sen. Ted Cruz, questioned federal limits on using political contributions received after an election to reimburse candidates for personal loans they made to their campaigns.
At issue was a $260,000 loan Mr. Cruz, a Republican, made to his campaign in 2018 when he was locked in a down-to-the-wire race against Democratic candidate Beto O’Rourke.
